title: Job 30:1
text: BUT now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

title: Job 30:2
text: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

title: Job 30:3
text: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

title: Job 30:4
text: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

title: Job 30:5
text: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)

title: Job 30:6
text: To dwell in the clifts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.

title: Job 30:7
text: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

title: Job 30:8
text: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

title: Job 30:9
text: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

title: Job 30:10
text: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

title: Job 30:11
text: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

title: Job 30:12
text: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

title: Job 30:13
text: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

title: Job 30:14
text: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.

title: Job 30:15
text: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.

title: Job 30:16
text: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

title: Job 30:17
text: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

title: Job 30:18
text: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

title: Job 30:19
text: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

title: Job 30:20
text: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.

title: Job 30:21
text: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.

title: Job 30:22
text: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.

title: Job 30:23
text: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

title: Job 30:24
text: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

title: Job 30:25
text: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble?  was not my soul grieved for the poor?

title: Job 30:26
text: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

title: Job 30:27
text: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

title: Job 30:28
text: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

title: Job 30:29
text: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

title: Job 30:30
text: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

title: Job 30:31
text: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
